summary: This is an email from FBI Special Agent Sean to colleagues, notifying them that due to Jeffrey Epstein's arrest and indictment, FBI agents from New York will be traveling to Florida to interview approximately 25 victims, primarily in the Miami/West Palm Beach area, with one victim in Palm Coast.

persons.name: Sean
persons.context: FBI Special Agent from the New York office, Squad C-20 (Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking), who is coordinating travel to Florida to interview victims following Epstein's arrest.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the arrest and indictment that prompted the FBI's travel to Florida to interview victims.

connections.description: Sean, as an FBI agent, is involved in the investigation following Epstein's arrest, coordinating victim interviews.

events.title: Epstein Arrest and Indigation Notification
events.description: FBI agents from New York notify colleagues of travel to Florida to interview approximately 25 victims following Jeffrey Epstein's arrest and indictment.

events.title: FBI Victim Interviews in Florida
events.description: FBI agents plan to begin interviewing victims in Florida, primarily in the Miami/West Palm Beach area and one in Palm Coast.

keyFacts: The FBI's New York office (Squad C-20, Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking) is traveling to Florida to interview approximately 25 victims following Jeffrey Epstein's arrest and indictment.
Most victims are located in the Miami/West Palm Beach area, with one victim in Palm Coast.
The email indicates a coordinated law enforcement response to Epstein's case, with victim interviews beginning shortly after his arrest.
The communication highlights the scale of the investigation, involving multiple victims across different Florida locations.
